title: Cocaine levels in Nantucket’s wastewater are growing exponentially. No one is sure exactly why.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cocaine levels in Nantucket's wastewater are 100% above national average, doubling the rate seen in September.
Recent cocaine spikes in wastewater suggest possible disposal or mixed use, despite few cocaine arrests, according to Police Chief Jody Kasper.
Nantucket's monitoring of various substances helps identify patterns, but exact causes of cocaine surges remain unclear.

title: Readers across Massachusetts share photos from Monday’s blizzard
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts blizzard snow totals exceeded 30 inches in some areas, affecting visibility and transforming daily scenes.
Boston.com readers shared photos depicting snow-covered sidewalks, low visibility, and activities during the storm.
Notable images include Harvard's BioLabs building and residents navigating deep snow in Scituate.

title: Massport: ‘there will be delays’ Tuesday at Logan Airport after the blizzard
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experienced 454 flight cancellations and 51 delays on Tuesday following a major nor'easter in the Northeast.
Massport advises travelers to check flight statuses and expect delays as flights gradually resume after the storm.
JetBlue is waiving change and cancel fees for affected flights due to the February nor'easter impacting the Northeast.

title: First responders in Cohasset carry patient with snowblower injury to ambulance, which then got stuck
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: First responders carried a snowblower injury patient to an ambulance during a blizzard in Cohasset, MA.
The ambulance got stuck in the snow and required shoveling before it could proceed, according to Cohasset police.
Over 1,000 residents lost power, and several roads were blocked by fallen trees and wires during the storm.

title: Review & setlist: Margo Price shows just enough country contrariness at Royale
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Margo Price performed at Royale in Boston on February 22, featuring songs influenced by Nashville's country music.
Her setlist included tracks like 'Hands Of Time,' 'Four Years Of Chances,' and covers of Woody Guthrie and Bob Dylan.
Price expressed her complex relationship with Nashville while showcasing her unique, throwback interpretation of country music.

title: Photo showing collapsed roof at Barking Crab amid blizzard was AI
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: A fake AI-generated photo showed the Barking Crab's roof collapsed, but the restaurant confirmed their roof is intact.
The Barking Crab shared a real photo on Instagram, highlighting the AI image was fake due to a Christmas wreath.
The AI photo spread quickly on social media, but the original Reddit post has been removed following confirmation of its inaccuracy.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying the day after the historic blizzard
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston's seasonal snowfall exceeds 60 inches, a milestone last seen during the winter of 2015.
Providence, RI reported 37.9 inches of snow, potentially setting a new state record if verified.
Boston recorded 17.1 inches of snow on February 23, setting a new daily record for that date.

title: 4 maps predicting totals from Wednesday morning’s snowfall
author: John Waller
bullets: Light snowfall expected Wednesday as a clipper passes north, developing overnight through mid-morning.
Boston forecast: 1-3 inches of snow with rain in lower elevations, higher amounts in hilly areas.
Snow predictions vary: most areas to get a coating to 2 inches, with up to 3 inches in higher terrain.

title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn teams canvass Boston offering blankets and rides to shelters during Monday's blizzard dropping 16+ inches of snow.
Outreach workers saw 50 people outside as the storm began, fewer than usual, indicating many sought shelter early.
Boston's shelters, with a 585-bed capacity, stretched to accommodate over 660 people using cots and mats on Sunday night.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of flights at Boston Logan Airport are canceled Tuesday due to a nor’easter.
Nearly 1,000 flights and several Amtrak trains were canceled as the blizzard impacted New England travel.
Amtrak aims to resume service for the Tuesday morning commute but expects some continued cancellations.
